meanings.definition: To attack or surprise from a concealed position.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky cat ambushed the unsuspecting mouse.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers ambushed the enemy troops in the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous siblings ambushed each other during their playful game.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rain ambushed our picnic, forcing us to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The clever spy ambushed the criminal gang with a well-planned strategy.

meanings.definition: To lie in wait for an enemy.
meanings.sent1: The hunter ambushed the deer by hiding behind a tree.
meanings.sent2: The bandits ambushed the travelers on the lonely road.
meanings.sent3: The kids ambushed their dad with water balloons on April Fools' Day.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past ambushed her mind unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The ninja ambushed the rival clan under the cover of darkness.
